prompt.content:
The following plot summary of a movie has had the sentences randomly reordered. Rewrite the plot summary with the sentences correctly ordered. Begin the plot summary with <PLOT_SUMMARY>.

The sentences are:

She decides to return to Phillotson, although she finds him sexually repugnant, as he is her true husband in the eyes of God. The boy comes to live with his father Jude, Sue and his half-siblings. The next day Sue and Jude return to their lodging to find that Juey has killed his half-siblings and committed suicide, hanging himself. Sue and Jude are forbidden a permanent rental lodging because their living arrangement without marriage is considered scandalous. His suicide note says the reason: "Becos we were to menny." There he encounters his cousin, Sue Bridehead (Winslet), who is beautiful and intelligent, and shares his disdain for convention. The marriage of Sue and Phillotson is not a success, as she refuses to give herself sexually or romantically to her husband. Whilst Jude is enraptured by Sue, she decides to marry Jude's former school teacher, Phillotson (Cunningham), after Jude tells her he is married to Arabella. He thinks education is available for any man who is willing to work hard. She leaves Phillotson to join Jude in what turns out to be a rough life, moving from place to place as Jude picks up occasional work as a stonemason. In the Victorian period, Jude Fawley (Eccleston) is a bright young lower-class man who dreams of a university education. Each of the couple falls into a deep depression after the deaths of their children. Jude learns that Arabella bore a son, which she named Jude ("Juey") soon after she left Jude. The two are in love and, over the course of years, Sue gives birth to two children. Sue tells Juey that the family cannot stay long at their present lodging because there are too many of them. Agnostic and independent, she refuses to legalize their arrangement by marriage. A year after the death of their children, Jude and Sue happen to meet when separately visiting the tombstones of their children. Meanwhile, Jude is rejected for the university based primarily on his lower-class status. He remains true to his dream and, months later, after his wife's sudden departure, he heads for the city. Turning to the religion she previously rejected, Sue comes to believe that God has judged and punished the couple for not having married. Circumstances conspire against him, and he is forced into a job as a stonemason and an unhappy marriage to a country girl, Arabella (Griffiths). They both look worse for wear. After a passionate kiss, she walks away from Jude to return to Phillotson. As Sue walks away, Jude shouts to her, "We are man and wife, if ever two people were on this earth!" Jude demands that Sue tell him whether she still loves him, to which she replies, "You've always known".

extra_info:

In the Victorian period, Jude Fawley (Eccleston) is a bright young lower-class man who dreams of a university education. Circumstances conspire against him, and he is forced into a job as a stonemason and an unhappy marriage to a country girl, Arabella (Griffiths). He remains true to his dream and, months later, after his wife's sudden departure, he heads for the city. He thinks education is available for any man who is willing to work hard. There he encounters his cousin, Sue Bridehead (Winslet), who is beautiful and intelligent, and shares his disdain for convention. Whilst Jude is enraptured by Sue, she decides to marry Jude's former school teacher, Phillotson (Cunningham), after Jude tells her he is married to Arabella. The next day Sue and Jude return to their lodging to find that Juey has killed his half-siblings and committed suicide, hanging himself. His suicide note says the reason: "Becos we were to menny."
Each of the couple falls into a deep depression after the deaths of their children. Turning to the religion she previously rejected, Sue comes to believe that God has judged and punished the couple for not having married. She decides to return to Phillotson, although she finds him sexually repugnant, as he is her true husband in the eyes of God.
A year after the death of their children, Jude and Sue happen to meet when separately visiting the tombstones of their children. They both look worse for wear. Jude demands that Sue tell him whether she still loves him, to which she replies, "You've always known". After a passionate kiss, she walks away from Jude to return to Phillotson.
As Sue walks away, Jude shouts to her, "We are man and wife, if ever two people were on this earth!"</PLOT_SUMMARY>"}

prompt.content:
Please output this exact text, with no changes at all except for fixing the misspellings. Please leave all other stylistic decisions like commas and US vs British spellings as in the original text.

When supercooled, liquidds viscosity increases dramatically as the glass transition temperature is approached. While the physical origin of this behaviour is still not understood, it is now wel established that the addition of a few activated particles is able to reverse thgatincrease in viscosity. Here we further rase tyhe question of a limit in thtafluidization process and of the differences between the fluidized liquid abd its vicous counterpert. Results show that a few percent active molecules are enough to tgrigger a phase transition leading to diffusion coefficients typical of liquids while thgemeedium retains cooperative properties of the viscmous phase. The similarity between cooperative peroperties of ther active and non active molecules tuggests that htemobility of ative molecules is transmitted to inactgive ones via the meddium cooperative mechanisms, a result in agreementy with facilitation theories. This result is then confirmed by the compared behaviour of htendistinct van hovee correletion functions of most mobile active end non active molecules. Interestingly enough, in our simulations tyhe cooperative mechanisms aree not induced or related to a decrease of the excityation concentration.You can think about it. Output the final answer in <solution></solution> tags.

extra_info: {"label": "When supercooled, liquids viscosity increases dramatically as the glass transition temperature is approached. While the physical origin of this behaviour is still not understood, it is now well established that the addition of a few activated particles is able to reverse that increase in viscosity. Here we further raise the question of a limit in that fluidization process and of the differences between the fluidized liquid and its viscous counterpart. Results show that a few percent active molecules are enough to trigger a phase transition leading to diffusion coefficients typical of liquids while the medium retains cooperative properties of the viscous phase. The similarity between cooperative properties of the active and non active molecules suggests that the mobility of active molecules is transmitted to inactive ones via the medium cooperative mechanisms, a result in agreement with facilitation theories. This result is then confirmed by the compared behaviour of the distinct van hove correlation functions of most mobile active and non active molecules. Interestingly enough, in our simulations the cooperative mechanisms are not induced or related to a decrease of the excitation concentration."}

prompt.content: You are given 16 words/phrases below. Find four groups of four items that share something in common. Here are a few examples of groups: bass, flounder, salmon, trout (all four are fish); ant, drill, island, opal (all four are two-word phrases that start with 'fire'); are, why, bee, queue (all four are homophones of letters); sea, sister, sin, wonder (all four are members of a septet). Categories will be more specific than e.g., '5-letter-words', 'names', or 'verbs'. There is exactly one solution. Think step-by-step, and then give your answer in <solution></solution> as a list of the 16 items separated by commas, ordered by group (for example, <solution>bass, founder, salmon, trout, ant, drill, island, opal</solution>). If you don't know the answer, make your best guess. The items are: CANARY, LEMON, MINION, MUSTARD, ADDITION, ANNEX, EXTENSION, WING, CALCULUS, CAVITY, PLAQUE, TARTAR, COLONEL, PHARAOH, WEDNESDAY, WORCESTERSHIRE
